param.name: input_select
param.label: select input type
param.option: List of SRA accession, one per line

param.name: accession
param.label: Accession
param.help: Must start with SRR, DRR or ERR, e.g. SRR925743, ERR343809

param.name: alignments
param.label: Output aligned or unaligned reads
param.help: Output reads according to their alignment status.

param.name: minMapq
param.label: Minimum mapping quality
param.help: Minimum mapping quality an alignment has to have, to be dumped.

param.name: region
param.label: aligned region
param.help: Filter by position on genome. Can be either accession.version (ex: NC_000001.10), chromosome name (ex:chr1 or 1) or 1-based coordinates (ex: chr1:1-101).

param.name: matepairDist
param.label: mate-pair distance (from-to|unknown)
param.help: Filter by distance between matepairs. Use unknown to find matepairs split between the references. Use from-to (inclusive) to limit matepair distance on the same reference

-----
**How to generate accession lists**
1. Go to **SRA Run Selector** by clicking this link_ 2. Find the study you are interested in by typing a search term within the **Search** box. This can be a word (e.g., *mitochondria*) or an accession you have gotten from a paper (e.g., *SRR1582967*). 3. Once you click on the study of interest you will see the number of datasets in this study within the **Related SRA data** box 4. Click on the Runs number 5. On the page that would open you will see **Accession List** button 6. Clicking of this button will produce a file that you will need to upload into Galaxy and use as the input to this tool.
